body: This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1043)

comment_data.body: You need to `#include "config.h"` like in the other files for the VANILLA_NACL symbol to be available.
Why do we want to abort? Do you expect all the callers to do `#ifndef VANILLA_NACL`?

My thinking is that for now at least, this would only be used interactively - giving an argument to a test to make it use a particular seed. So having it fail if we don't have libsodium is not too bad. A separate implementation for NaCl can wait.
Ok, I thought we'd use this for all tests always, but I can see some advantages to not doing so, so this is fine.

comment_regular_data.body:

You have signed the CLA already but the status is still pending? Let us [recheck](https://cla-assistant.io/check/TokTok/c-toxcore?pullRequest=1043) it.

>iphydf requested changes on this pull request.

Done all.

>Needs `#ifndef VANILLA_NACL` so it works for non-libsodium 
>implementations of nacl.

Travis (using autotools with --enable-nacl) seems to still be unhappy, 
and I don't know why.
